meanings.definition: A lively dance in triple time, popular in Provence.
meanings.sent1: The children joyfully danced the farandole at the village festival.
meanings.sent2: The farandole played by the musicians had a catchy rhythm.
meanings.sent3: During the farandole, the cat joined in with its own little dance.
meanings.sent4: The farandole of laughter filled the room as friends danced together.
meanings.sent5: The colorful costumes added to the festive atmosphere of the farandole.

meanings.definition: A piece of music for this dance.
meanings.sent1: The band performed a lively farandole that got everyone on their feet.
meanings.sent2: The farandole's melody was so catchy that it stayed in my head all day.
meanings.sent3: The farandole music echoed through the streets, drawing people to dance.
meanings.sent4: The farandole of notes intertwined beautifully in the orchestra's performance.
meanings.sent5: The farandole's rhythm was so infectious that even the shyest person couldn't resist dancing.

meanings.definition: A chain or garland of flowers.
meanings.sent1: She wore a lovely farandole of daisies around her neck.
meanings.sent2: The bride's hair was adorned with a delicate farandole of roses.
meanings.sent3: The garden was decorated with a farandole of colorful blooms for the party.
meanings.sent4: The farandole of flowers added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the farandole of blossoms filled the air at the garden party.
